info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 26 at 8:43PM EDT until June 26 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CUMBERLAND...EASTERN PRINCE EDWARD...NORTHWESTERN AMELIA AND SOUTHWESTERN POWHATAN COUNTIES... At 843 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northwest of Jetersville, or 9 miles south of Cumberland, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... Jetersville and Sunnyside around 855 PM EDT. Morven and Tobaccoville around 905 PM EDT. Amelia Courthouse around 915 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Paineville, Maplewood, Angola, Stoddert, Deatonville, Rodophil, Lodore, Truxillo and Hawk. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
